tn.text: The author is writing about Solomon's palace.

tn.ref: Solomon took thirteen years to build his own palace
tn.text: Because Solomon was the king, others did the work for him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
If your language does not have a word for "palace," you may translate this as "house" or "big house."

tn.ref: the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon
tn.text: "the house called the House of the Lebanon Forest"

tn.ref: one hundred cubits ... fifty cubits ... thirty cubits
tn.text: A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "46 meters ... 23 meters ... 13.8 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
A beam is a long piece of strong wood used to support walls and roofs.
Some details are given about the structure of the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon.

tn.ref: The house was roofed with cedar that rested on beams
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The carpenters built a roof from cedar planks and attached them to beams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
long pieces of strong wood usually used to support a roof
"had rectangular frames" (UDB)
The author writes about the structure of the Hall of Pillars.
a series of columns, all the same distance apart
A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "23 meters ... 13.8 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
an area of a building made of columns and a roof that leads to and connects with the building's entrance door. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:06:03|6:3]]
The author writes about the hall of the throne.

tn.ref: Solomon built the hall of the throne
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "Solomon built the house in which he was going to place his throne" or 2) "Solomon had his workers build a house named The King's Chair House."
This can be stated in active form. AT: "The workers covered the floor with cedar wood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to the entire floor. AT: "from one wall to the other"
The author continues to write about the palace area.

tn.ref: Solomon's house in which he was to live, in another courtyard within the palace grounds, was similarly designed
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Solomon had someone design the house in which he was to live, in another courtyard within the palace grounds, in the same way" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The writer is writing about the stones used for the buildings.

tn.ref: These buildings were adorned with costly hewn stones
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The workers adorned the buildings with costly, hewn stones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: hewn stones, precisely measured and cut with a saw and smoothed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "hewn stones, that workers had precisely measured and cut with a saw and smoothed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "The workers used these stones" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: from the foundation to the stones on top, and also on the outside to the great court
tn.text: The author is emphasizing that the workers used expensive stones for the foundations and all the buildings.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "The workers constructed the foundation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "about 3.7 meters and 4.6 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
A beam is a long piece of wood used for structural support.

tn.ref: three rows of cut stone and a row of cedar beams
tn.text: Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:06:36|6:36]].
Huram accepted Solomon's invitation to come to Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the son of a widow ... his father was a man of Tyre
tn.text: A widow is a woman whose husband has died, so we know that the father is dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Huram was filled with wisdom and understanding and skill
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. The words "wisdom and understanding" mean basically the same thing and are used together for emphasis. Yahweh giving such things as wisdom is spoken of as if they were liquids that Yahweh had poured into a container, and Huram is spoken of as if he were that container. AT: "Yahweh had given Huram wisdom, understanding, and skill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: eighteen cubits ... twelve cubits ... five cubits
tn.text: A cubit is about 46 centimeters. AT: "about 8.3 meters ... 5.5 meters ... 2.3 cubits" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
Circumference is the distance or measurement around a circular object or area.
decorations on top of each of the two pillars
They polished the bronze so that it would reflect sunlight. "gleaming bronze" (UDB)

tn.ref: Checker latticework and wreaths of chain work
tn.text: "Crossed metal strips woven together and metal chains twisted together"
A pomegranate is a fruit with a hard, red rind and many juicy seeds inside. Huram did not use real pomegranates to decorate the pillars. He made them out of bronze.

tn.ref: The capitals ... were decorated with lilies, four cubits high
tn.text: Lilies are plants whose flowers are wide at one end and very narrow at the other end. These words can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram decorated the capitals ... with bronze lilies, four cubits high" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Translate "portico" as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:07:06|7:6]].
A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "about 1.8 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
"200 pomegranates." A pomegranate is a fruit with a hard, red rind and many juicy seeds inside. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:07:18|7:18]] (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
It might be best to translate so that the reader understands that other people helped Huram do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: The pillar on the right was named Jakin
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The name of the pillar on the right side was Jakin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the pillar on the left was named Boaz
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The name of the pillar on the left side was Boaz" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The fashioning of the pillars was done
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram fashioned the pillars" or "Huram's men fashioned the pillars" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to a bronze tank or basin that would hold water.
Huram melted the bronze and formed it in a mold.

tn.ref: ten cubits ... five cubits ... thirty cubits
tn.text: A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "4.6 meters ... 2.3 meters ... 13.8 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
"from one edge to the other"
Circumference is the distance or measurement around a circular object or area.
A gourd is a type of hard, round vegetable that grows on a vine on the ground.

tn.ref: when the sea itself was cast
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when Huram cast the sea itself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to a bronze tank or basin that would hold water.
"was on top of"

tn.ref: The sea was set on top of them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram's workers set the sea on top of the bronze oxen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the back quarter of the body of an animal with four feet.

tn.ref: its brim was forged like the brim of a cup, like a lily blossom
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram forged the brim to look like the brim of a cup, to curve outward like a lily" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
A bath is a unit of volume equal to about 22 liters. AT: "2,000 baths" or "44,000 liters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "about 1.8 meters ... about 1.4 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: The work of the stands was like this
tn.text: This means the author will describe the stands in the words that follow.

tn.ref: on the panels and on the frames were lions, oxen, and cherubim
tn.text: There were decorative pieces in the shapes of lions, oxen, and cherubim fastened to the sides of the stands.
Here the word "wreaths" refers to spiral-shaped pieces of bronze.
There was one axle for each pair of wheels. AT: "four bronze wheels and two axles" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"the four corners of each stand"

tn.ref: The supports were cast with wreaths
tn.text: Each support was cast as one piece with the wreaths. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram cast the supports with spiral-shaped pieces" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: a cubit and a half ... a cubit
tn.text: A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "about 70 centimeters ... about 50 centimeters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])
Here the word "crown" refers to the circular piece at the top of the stand's opening that held the basin.
"the panels of the stands were square." This phrase returns to the description of the panels that began in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:07:27|7:28-29]].
Here the word "their" refers to the axles. The word "housings" refers to the casings into which the axles were inserted.
A cubit was 46 centimeters. AT: "about 70 centimeters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: The wheels were forged like chariot wheels
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram made the wheels like small chariot wheels" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Their housings, rims, spokes, and hubs
tn.text: Here the word "Their" refers to the wheels.

tn.ref: There were four handles at the four corners of each stand
tn.text: "There was a handle at each of the four corners of each stand"
A cubit was 46 centimeters. AT: "twenty-three centimeters wide" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: on the top of the stand its supports and panels were attached
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram attached the supports and panels to the top of each stand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here the word "they" refers to the cherubim, lions, and palm trees.
The word "wreaths" refers to spiral-shaped pieces of bronze. This can be stated in active form. AT: "there were wreaths all around them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: All of them were cast in the same molds
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Huram cast all of the stands in the same mold" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they had one size, and the same shape
tn.text: "all of the stands were the same size and shape"
A bath is a unit of volume equal to about 22 liters. AT: "about 88 liters" or "about 90 liters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bvolume]])
A cubit is 46 centimeters. AT: "about 1.8 meters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bdistance]])

tn.ref: on the east corner, facing toward the south of the temple
tn.text: "on the southeast corner of the temple"
like capitals** - The capitals were shaped like bowls. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"crossed metal strips woven together"
"400 pomegranates." A pomegranate is a fruit with a hard, red rind and many juicy seeds inside. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:07:18|7:18]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Here the word "He" refers to Huram and his helpers. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"all the other tools"
bronze that was polished so that it would reflect light
It might be best to translate so that the reader understands that other people helped the king do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"flat land near the Jordan River"
names of cities (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Solomon did not weigh all the utensils
tn.text: Solomon would not have done the work himself anyway. AT: "Solomon did not have Huram and his workers weigh all the utensils" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the weight of the bronze could not be measured
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one could measure the weight of the bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
It might be best to translate so that the reader understands that other people helped Solomon do this. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: on which the bread of the presence was to be placed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "on which the priests were to place the bread of the presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The "flowers" and "lamps" were part of the lampstands.

tn.ref: The cups ... were all made of pure gold
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The workers made the cups ... out of pure gold" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Also the sockets ... were all made of gold
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "They also made the sockets ... out of gold" (See [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "sockets" may refer to either 1) the sockets in which the door pegs turned, or 2) the hinges on which the doors hung.

tn.ref: the work that King Solomon did for the house of Yahweh was finished
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the workers finished the work that King Solomon had them do for the house of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
